intro: Eriocaulon kiusianum, commonly known as the Kiusianum sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its morphology includes slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The botanical features of Eriocaulon kiusianum make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and habitat structure.
